page.title: 12Wivelsfield - Farming (2)
page.content:
{Cattle are the principal livestock}in this block. To comply with EEC milk quotas,more beef and less dairy cattle are being kept.{Beef -}Sussex Red, Aberdeen Angus, Sussex Simmental cross and Herefords. Limousins from France are now being bred to boost beef production.{Dairy - }Fresians and Jerseys. The cattle are sold at Haywards Heath Market 3 miles away. { {Pigs}are bred and sold as weaners to other farmers.{Chickens}are raised for sale to local shops and to owners of domestic freezers. Southdown Cross and Welsh Black{Sheep}are kept for both meat and wool.
Many of the animals will be taken to the{abbatoir}in Wivelsfield Green for slaughtering after they have been sold.
